sharedBanner.title: Someone Shared Their Results With You!
sharedBanner.description: This is a preview of what you could discover about your own longevity. Want to know your biological age and longevity score?

summary.title: Your Longevity Summary
summary.excellent: Your Longevity Impact Score of {{score}} demonstrates exceptional health fundamentals. You're in the top tier of longevity optimisation, with lifestyle choices that are actively supporting healthy cellular ageing.
summary.good: Your Longevity Impact Score of {{score}} shows a strong foundation for healthy ageing. Your current lifestyle strategies are working well, and with some targeted improvements, you could see significant gains in your longevity trajectory.
summary.fair: Your Longevity Impact Score of {{score}} reveals both areas of strength and meaningful opportunities for improvement. While some of your lifestyle habits are supporting your health, there's significant potential to optimise your longevity trajectory.
summary.needsWork: Your Longevity Impact Score of {{score}} indicates that your current lifestyle patterns are significantly impacting your biological ageing. The good news? This presents a valuable opportunity for transformative improvement‚Äîsmall, consistent changes can make a big difference.
summary.strengthsTwo: Your {{first}} score of {{firstScore}} and {{second}} score of {{secondScore}} are your most powerful longevity drivers. These pillars are actively supporting healthy cellular ageing and contributing positively to your overall healthspan.
summary.strengthsOne: Your {{first}} score of {{firstScore}} is your strongest longevity driver, actively supporting healthy cellular ageing.
summary.priorityTwo: However, your {{first}} score of {{firstScore}} and {{second}} score of {{secondScore}} are holding back your overall potential. Addressing these areas could help reduce your biological age by an estimated {{years}} years over time.
summary.priorityOne: Your {{first}} score of {{firstScore}} represents your biggest opportunity for improvement. Focusing here could meaningfully impact your biological age.
summary.insightInterconnected: The interconnection between {{first}} and {{second}} suggests that improving one may naturally enhance the other‚Äîconsider starting with {{lowest}} for the biggest cascade effect on your overall score.
summary.insightLowest: Your {{pillar}} score is significantly below your other pillars, making it your highest-leverage area for improvement. Even modest changes here could have an outsized impact on your overall longevity trajectory.
summary.insightBalanced: Your pillars are relatively balanced, which is excellent! A holistic approach that fine-tunes all areas will yield the best results for maximising your longevity potential.
summary.insightFocus: Focus your energy on improving your {{pillar}} score first‚Äîthis is where you'll see the quickest wins and build momentum for your longevity journey.

bioAge.title: Your Biological Age Estimate
bioAge.explanation: Biological age is an indicator of how well your body may be functioning at a cellular level. This assessment uses lifestyle factors to provide an indicative biological age estimate. Chronological age is simply the number of years you've been alive. Your lifestyle choices, stress levels, sleep quality, and nutrition can make your body function younger or older than your calendar age.
bioAge.agingRate: Based on your LIS score of {{score}}, your lifestyle indicates you could be ageing approximately {{rate}}x the normal rate ({{comparison}} average).
bioAge.younger: üéâ Your biological age is {{years}} years younger than your chronological age!
bioAge.same: Your biological age matches your chronological age.
bioAge.older: ‚ö†Ô∏è Your biological age is {{years}} years older than your chronological age.

trajectory.title: Your Ageing Trajectory
trajectory.inYears: In {{years}} years you'll be {{age}} years old
trajectory.improvement5yr: üí° Improvement Potential: {{years}} years younger biological age
trajectory.reduction: That's a {{percent}}% reduction in biological ageing over {{years}} years!
trajectory.extraYears: That's like turning back the clock by gaining {{years}} extra years of vitality
trajectory.calculationBasis: Calculation basis: Optimised scenario assumes achieving an LIS score of 85 through evidence-based biohacking interventions. Your current ageing rate: {{rate}}x per year.
trajectory.disclaimer: Important: Your Longevity Impact Score is an estimation based on self-reported lifestyle factors and health behaviours. While this assessment provides valuable insights into your longevity trajectory, it is not a substitute for clinical testing. For a more accurate cellular-level biological age measurement, we recommend taking a clinical test including comprehensive blood work, inflammation markers, metabolic panels, and hormonal assessments.

hormoneResults.domainAnalysisSubtitle: Expand each domain to see specific insights and recommendations
hormoneResults.disclaimerParagraph1: Your Hormone Compass assessment is based on self-reported symptoms and lifestyle factors. This is not a medical diagnosis and should not replace professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.
hormoneResults.disclaimerParagraph2: We strongly recommend consulting with a qualified healthcare provider (gynaecologist, endocrinologist, or hormone specialist) if you're experiencing concerning symptoms, especially if marked as "critical" or "struggling" in any domain. Clinical hormone testing (blood work, salivary tests) provides more accurate assessment than self-reported data.
hormoneResults.disclaimerParagraph3: The recommendations provided are evidence-based general wellness suggestions and do not constitute medical advice for your specific situation.
hormoneResults.protocolSubtitle: 3-tier action plan based on your specific domain scores
hormoneResults.protocolDisclaimer: Note: This protocol is generated based on your assessment responses and represents general wellness recommendations. It is not personalised medical advice. Consult your healthcare provider before starting any new supplement regimen, especially if you have existing health conditions or take medications.

feelingGreat.title: Feeling Great
feelingGreat.description: Your hormone health is thriving. You're experiencing minimal disruption across key areas.
feelingGreat.spectrumContext: It sounds like you're feeling great ‚Äî this is the optimal level of hormone health (the best of five tiers). You're doing everything right to support your hormonal balance.

doingWell.title: Doing Well
doingWell.description: Your hormone health is good with mild occasional symptoms. Small adjustments can optimise your well-being.
doingWell.spectrumContext: It sounds like you're doing well ‚Äî this is above average, the second-best tier out of five. You're in good shape with room for minor optimisation to reach peak hormone health.

havingChallenges.title: Having Challenges
havingChallenges.description: You're experiencing moderate symptoms that are affecting daily life. Support can help restore balance.
havingChallenges.spectrumContext: It sounds like you're having challenges ‚Äî this is the middle level out of five tiers. You're experiencing noticeable disruption that warrants attention and targeted intervention.

reallyStruggling.title: Really Struggling
reallyStruggling.description: You're facing significant symptoms that are impacting your quality of life. Professional support is recommended.
reallyStruggling.spectrumContext: It sounds like you're really struggling ‚Äî this is the second-lowest level out of five tiers. You're experiencing substantial hormone-related impacts that need comprehensive support.

needSupport.title: Need Support Now
needSupport.description: You're experiencing severe symptoms that require immediate professional attention and comprehensive support.
needSupport.spectrumContext: It sounds like you need support now ‚Äî this is the most critical level out of five tiers. You're experiencing severe hormone disruption that requires immediate medical attention and comprehensive intervention.

lifeStageContexts.age25to35Challenges: At your age, these symptoms may indicate PCOS, thyroid imbalances, or cycle irregularities. Consider working with a healthcare provider to identify root causes.
lifeStageContexts.age25to35Normal: You're in your prime reproductive years. Focus on establishing healthy baseline habits and tracking patterns.
lifeStageContexts.age36to44Challenges: These symptoms could be early signs of hormonal shifts as you approach perimenopause, or may indicate other hormonal imbalances worth investigating.
lifeStageContexts.age36to44Normal: You're approaching the perimenopausal transition window. Now is an ideal time to optimise hormone health and establish strong habits.
lifeStageContexts.age45to55Challenges: These symptoms are common during the perimenopause transition. Targeted support can significantly improve your quality of life during this phase.
lifeStageContexts.age45to55Normal: You're in the typical perimenopause window. Proactive support can help you navigate this transition smoothly.
lifeStageContexts.age56PlusChallenges: If you're experiencing ongoing symptoms in postmenopause, hormone replacement therapy or targeted interventions may provide relief. Consult with your provider.
lifeStageContexts.age56PlusNormal: You're in the postmenopause phase. Focus on longevity optimisation‚Äîbone health, cardiovascular support, and cognitive function.

cyclePeriodPatterns.critical: Urgent: Severe symptoms may require immediate medical evaluation
cyclePeriodPatterns.struggling: Significant irregularity may affect fertility and long-term health
cyclePeriodPatterns.challenges: May indicate hormone imbalance affecting your cycle regularity
cyclePeriodPatterns.good: Minor fluctuations‚Äîsmall optimisations can enhance balance
cyclePeriodPatterns.thriving: Healthy regular cycles suggest balanced hormone production

sleepThermoregulation.critical: Urgent: Severe sleep issues may critically impact your health
sleepThermoregulation.struggling: Temperature dysregulation may significantly disrupt sleep quality
sleepThermoregulation.challenges: Sleep disruption could affect hormone production and repair
sleepThermoregulation.good: Occasional disruptions‚Äîoptimisation can further support hormones
sleepThermoregulation.thriving: Excellent sleep quality may support optimal hormone production

moodFocus.critical: Urgent: Severe symptoms may require immediate professional support
moodFocus.struggling: Significant disruption could interfere with daily quality of life
moodFocus.challenges: Mood instability may indicate hormone or neurotransmitter dysfunction
moodFocus.good: Generally stable with occasional challenges‚Äîtargeted support helps
moodFocus.thriving: Balanced mood and clarity suggest healthy neurotransmitter levels

energyWeight.critical: Urgent: Extreme fatigue may require immediate medical attention
energyWeight.struggling: Severe fatigue could indicate metabolic or endocrine disruption
energyWeight.challenges: Could suggest metabolic disruption affecting energy and weight
energyWeight.thriving: Stable energy and weight suggest healthy metabolism

libidoSexualHealth.critical: Urgent: Severe symptoms may require immediate medical evaluation
libidoSexualHealth.struggling: Significant loss of libido may impact intimacy and wellbeing
libidoSexualHealth.challenges: Reduced libido and discomfort may indicate hormone changes
libidoSexualHealth.good: Minor concerns‚Äîsmall adjustments can enhance comfort
libidoSexualHealth.thriving: Strong sexual health suggests healthy sex hormone levels

skinHairNails.critical: Urgent: Severe changes may indicate serious nutrient deficiency
skinHairNails.struggling: Significant changes may indicate hormone or nutrient imbalance
skinHairNails.challenges: Changes suggest collagen loss or nutrient depletion
skinHairNails.thriving: Healthy appearance suggests good hormone balance and nutrients

lifespan.label: Potential Life Expectancy Increase
lifespan.evidenceTitle: Healthy Lifestyle Factors and Life Expectancy
lifespan.citation: Li Y, Pan A, Wang DD, et al. (2018). Impact of Healthy Lifestyle Factors on Life Expectancies in the US Population. Circulation, 138(4):345-355.
lifespan.finding: Following 5 low-risk lifestyle factors (never smoking, healthy BMI, regular physical activity, moderate alcohol intake, high-quality diet) was associated with a 12-14 year increase in life expectancy at age 50 compared to those following none of these factors.

control.label: Of how you age is in your control
control.citation: Kaplanis J, et al. (2018). Quantitative analysis of population-scale family trees with millions of relatives. Science, 360(6385):171-175.
control.finding: Genetic factors account for only 20-30% of longevity variation. The remaining 70-80% is attributed to modifiable lifestyle and environmental factors, demonstrating the profound impact of daily choices on healthspan and lifespan.

evidence.label: Scientific Evidence Based
evidence.citation: BiohackHer Research Database (2024). Peer-reviewed studies from PubMed, Cochrane Library, and women's health journals.
evidence.finding: All protocol recommendations are derived from 500+ peer-reviewed studies specifically focused on women's health, longevity, and hormonal optimisation. Each recommendation is linked to primary research evidence.

lis.quote: I discovered I was ageing 8 years faster than my chronological age. After following my protocol for 3 months, my LIS score improved from 58 to 74. I feel like I've reversed the clock.
lis.author: Sarah M., 47, Sydney

nutrition.quote: My nutrition score was 51‚ÄîI had no idea I was missing so much. The supplement protocol fixed my energy crashes and brain fog within 2 weeks. Game changer.
nutrition.author: Emma L., 52, Melbourne

hormone.quote: The Hormone Compass helped me understand my perimenopause symptoms weren't 'just stress.' The targeted protocol reduced hot flashes by 80% in 6 weeks.
hormone.author: Lisa K., 49, Brisbane

categoryDescriptions.poor: Your assessment indicates significant challenges with {{assessmentName}} that are likely impacting your daily quality of life. These results suggest that professional support could be highly beneficial in developing targeted strategies for improvement.
categoryDescriptions.poorAreas: The areas showing the greatest impact are: {{areas}}. Addressing these specific aspects could lead to substantial improvements in your overall wellbeing.
categoryDescriptions.fair: Your results show that {{assessmentName}} is affecting various aspects of your life to a moderate degree. Whilst you're managing some areas well, there's meaningful room for improvement that could significantly enhance your daily experience.
categoryDescriptions.fairFocus: Focus particularly on: {{areas}}. Targeted interventions in these areas, combined with the toolkit recommendations below, can help you move towards optimal wellbeing.
categoryDescriptions.fairStrengths: You're already doing well with: {{strengths}}. These strengths can serve as a foundation as you work on other areas.
categoryDescriptions.good: Your assessment shows that you're managing {{assessmentName}} well overall. You've developed effective strategies that are working for you, though there are still opportunities for optimisation.
categoryDescriptions.goodStrengths: Your particular strengths lie in: {{strengths}}. Maintaining these positive habits whilst addressing minor areas for improvement can help you reach excellent outcomes.
categoryDescriptions.goodAreas: Small refinements in: {{areas}} could elevate your results to the excellent range.
categoryDescriptions.excellent: Outstanding results! You've developed highly effective strategies for managing {{assessmentName}}. Your approach is working exceptionally well, and you're experiencing optimal outcomes in this area of health.
categoryDescriptions.excellentStrengths: You excel particularly in: {{strengths}}. These successful strategies could be valuable templates for optimising other areas of your health journey.
categoryDescriptions.excellentMaintain: Focus on maintaining these positive habits and consider exploring the evidence-based tools below to sustain and further enhance your wellbeing.

memory.title: Enhance Memory Function
memory.description: Try cognitive exercises like learning a new language or musical instrument. Consider omega-3 supplementation and prioritise 7-9 hours of quality sleep, as memory consolidation occurs during deep sleep stages.

focus.title: Improve Focus and Attention
focus.description: Implement the Pomodoro Technique (25-minute focused work sessions). Reduce screen time before tasks requiring concentration. Consider meditation practice starting with 5-10 minutes daily to build attention span.

anxiety.title: Manage Anxiety and Stress
anxiety.description: Practice daily breathing exercises (4-7-8 technique). Consider cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT) for lasting change. Regular aerobic exercise (30 mins, 5x/week) significantly reduces anxiety symptoms. Limit caffeine intake after midday.

mood.title: Support Emotional Wellbeing
mood.description: Maintain consistent sleep-wake times to regulate mood. Ensure daily sunlight exposure, especially in morning. Regular social connection is crucial - schedule weekly catch-ups. Consider journalling to process emotions.

sleep.title: Optimise Sleep Quality
sleep.description: Establish a consistent sleep schedule (same bedtime/wake time daily). Create a cool, dark bedroom (18-20¬∞C). Avoid screens 1 hour before bed. Consider magnesium glycinate supplementation 1-2 hours before sleep.

energy.title: Boost Energy Levels
energy.description: Check iron and B12 levels through bloodwork. Eat balanced meals every 3-4 hours to maintain stable blood sugar. Take short walking breaks every 90 minutes. Stay hydrated (aim for 2-3L water daily).

pain.title: Address Physical Discomfort
pain.description: Incorporate daily gentle stretching or yoga. Consider physiotherapy assessment for persistent pain. Anti-inflammatory diet (increase omega-3s, reduce processed foods). Apply heat/cold therapy as appropriate.

cognitive.title: Enhance Cognitive Processing
cognitive.description: Stay mentally active with puzzles, reading, or learning new skills. Ensure adequate hydration throughout the day. Consider checking thyroid function and vitamin D levels. Regular aerobic exercise improves processing speed.

professional.title: Seek Professional Guidance
professional.description: Given your current results, consulting with a healthcare professional can provide personalised assessment and treatment options. They can rule out underlying conditions and create a tailored intervention plan.

maintain.title: Maintain Your Strengths
maintain.description: You're performing well in: {{strengths}}. Continue these positive habits whilst addressing other areas. Your success here demonstrates your capacity for positive health changes.

general.title: Continue Your Health Journey
general.description: Explore our evidence-based toolkit for science-backed interventions tailored to your specific needs. Small, consistent changes compound over time for significant improvements.

toolkit.description: Evidence-based biohacking tools tailored to your assessment results

lisResults.bioAgeExplanation: Biological age is an indicator of how well your body may be functioning at a cellular level. This assessment uses lifestyle factors to provide an indicative biological age estimate. Chronological age is simply the number of years you've been alive. Your lifestyle choices, stress levels, sleep quality, and nutrition can make your body function younger or older than your calendar age.
lisResults.in5Years: In 5 years you'll be {{age}} years old
lisResults.in20Years: In 20 years you'll be {{age}} years old
lisResults.improvementPotential: Improvement Potential: {{years}} years younger biological age
lisResults.reductionPercent: That's a {{percent}}% reduction in biological ageing over 5 years!
lisResults.turningBackClock: That's like turning back the clock by gaining {{years}} extra years of vitality
lisResults.calculationBasis: Calculation basis: Optimised scenario assumes achieving an LIS score of 85 through evidence-based biohacking interventions. Your current ageing rate: {{rate}}x per year.
lisResults.bioAgeDisclaimer: Your Longevity Impact Score is an estimation based on self-reported lifestyle factors and health behaviours. While this assessment provides valuable insights into your longevity trajectory, it is not a substitute for clinical testing. For a more accurate cellular-level biological age measurement, we recommend taking a clinical test including comprehensive blood work, inflammation markers, metabolic panels, and hormonal assessments.

sections.whatsHappening: What's Actually Happening in Your Body
sections.symptomPatternDescription: How your symptoms interconnect and create feedback loops
sections.severityDescription: How your responses map across key health domains
sections.healthInsights: Health Insights: What's Happening in Your Body
sections.predictiveInsights: Predictive insights about your symptom progression
sections.understandingDesc: Now that you understand the specific physiological patterns in your body, the section below shows evidence-based interventions that may support these mechanisms.
sections.interventionsDesc: Each intervention is explicitly linked to the insights above and organised by type‚Äîlifestyle changes first, optional nutritional support last. This helps you make informed decisions based on your unique physiology.

pre.title: Pre-Menopause
pre.description: Your cycles are still regular, and you're not experiencing significant hormonal changes yet.
recommendations: Focus on establishing healthy habits now
Track your cycles to establish a baseline
Consider preventive nutrition and exercise
Monitor energy and mood patterns

earlyPeri.title: Early Perimenopause
earlyPeri.description: You're beginning to experience subtle hormonal shifts. Cycles may become slightly irregular.
recommendations: Start tracking symptoms consistently
Consider adaptogenic herbs for hormone support
Optimise sleep hygiene
Add strength training to preserve muscle mass

midPeri.title: Mid Perimenopause
midPeri.description: Hormonal fluctuations are more pronounced. You may notice significant cycle changes and symptoms.
recommendations: Focus on stress management and cortisol regulation
Consider magnesium for sleep and mood
Increase phytoestrogen-rich foods
Track hot flashes and night sweats patterns

latePeri.title: Late Perimenopause
latePeri.description: You're approaching menopause. Periods may be very irregular or absent for months.
recommendations: Support bone health with vitamin D and K2
Focus on cardiovascular exercise
Consider hormone testing with your doctor
Optimise gut health for hormone metabolism

post.title: Post-Menopause
post.description: It's been 12+ months since your last period. Focus shifts to long-term health optimisation.
recommendations: Prioritise bone density and cardiovascular health
Continue strength training
Focus on longevity nutrition
Monitor metabolic health markers

disclaimer.title: Important: Educational Purposes Only
disclaimer.text: This analysis is based on your symptom responses and published research. It is for educational purposes only and should not replace professional medical advice. Always consult with qualified healthcare professionals before starting any supplementation, treatment protocol, or making significant health decisions.

interventions.title: Evidence-Based Interventions to Consider

brainAssessment.title: Brain Health Assessment
brainAssessment.excellentPerformance: Excellent performance across all categories! Focus on maintenance and continued optimisation.
brainAssessment.targetedOptimization: targeted optimisation could elevate your cognitive performance
brainAssessment.pageSubtitleMenopause: Assess how hormonal changes affect your cognition

results.title: Brain Health Results
results.subtitle: Your brain assessment is complete
results.excellent: Excellent cognitive performance! Your overall score of {{score}}/100 indicates optimal brain function across multiple domains. You're operating at a high level cognitively, with particularly strong performance in areas scoring above 75.
results.good: Good cognitive function with your score of {{score}}/100. While you're performing well overall, there are specific areas where targeted optimisation could elevate your cognitive performance to the next level.
results.fair: Fair cognitive performance. Your score of {{score}}/100 suggests you're experiencing notable cognitive challenges that are likely impacting your daily function. The good news is that with targeted, evidence-based interventions, significant improvements are achievable.
results.needsAttention: Your cognitive function requires immediate attention. A score of {{score}}/100 indicates substantial challenges across multiple cognitive domains that are significantly affecting your quality of life. A comprehensive, multi-faceted approach is strongly recommended.

strengths.title: Your Strengths
strengths.memory: Strong memory and recall capabilities - maintain this with continued cognitive engagement
strengths.focus: Excellent concentration and sustained attention abilities
strengths.processing: Fast processing speed and quick decision-making capacity
strengths.clarity: Clear, sharp thinking with minimal brain fog
strengths.noStrengths: Your cognitive profile shows areas that would benefit from targeted support. The recommendations below will help you build new strengths.

priorities.title: Priority Focus Areas
priorities.memoryOptimise: Can be optimised with specific strategies
priorities.processingEnhance: Can be enhanced with targeted exercises
priorities.allExcellent: Excellent performance across all categories! Focus on maintenance and continued optimisation.

actionPlan.title: Your Personalised Action Plan
actionPlan.subtitle: Evidence-based interventions tailored to your cognitive profile

nextSteps.title: Recommended Next Steps
nextSteps.step1: Review your detailed results above and identify your top 1-2 priority areas
nextSteps.step2: Start with the first recommendation from your action plan within the next 48 hours
nextSteps.step3: Track your progress daily to monitor improvements and adjust strategies
nextSteps.step4: Consider booking a consultation with a healthcare provider specialising in cognitive health
nextSteps.step5: Reassess your cognitive performance in 4-6 weeks to measure progress

navigation.resultsSaved: Your results have been saved and will be tracked over time to monitor your progress

q1.question: How would you rate your short-term memory and ability to recall information?
q1.poor: Poor - Frequently forget things within minutes
q1.fair: Fair - Sometimes forget details or names

q2.question: How easily can you maintain focus on demanding cognitive tasks?
q2.challenging: Challenging - Struggle to concentrate for long
q2.excellent: Excellent - Deep focus for extended periods

q3.question: How quickly do you process new information and make decisions?
q3.slow: Slow - Takes time to understand and respond

q4.question: How clear and sharp does your thinking feel throughout the day?
q4.crystal: Crystal clear - Consistently sharp and alert

q5.question: How well can you hold and manipulate information in your mind?
q5.poor: Poor - Difficult to juggle multiple pieces of info
q5.fair: Fair - Can handle simple mental tasks
q5.good: Good - Can manage complex mental tasks
q5.excellent: Excellent - Easily handle multiple complex inputs

q6.question: How would you describe your mental energy levels?
q6.depleted: Depleted - Mentally exhausted most of the day
q6.low: Low - Energy drops significantly after tasks
q6.moderate: Moderate - Steady energy with some dips
q6.high: High - Sustained mental energy throughout day

q7.question: How easily do you learn and retain new skills or information?
q7.difficult: Difficult - Takes many repetitions to learn
q7.slow: Slow - Need significant time to master new things
q7.moderate: Moderate - Learn at a normal pace
q7.fast: Fast - Quickly grasp and retain new information

q8.question: How does your sleep quality affect your cognitive performance?
q8.severe: Severe - Poor sleep significantly impairs cognition
q8.moderate: Moderate - Noticeable cognitive impact from sleep
q8.mild: Mild - Slight impact from sleep quality
q8.minimal: Minimal - Maintain performance despite sleep variation

q9.question: How well does your cognitive performance hold up under stress?
q9.poor: Poor - Performance drops significantly under pressure
q9.good: Good - Mostly maintain performance under stress

q10.question: How effectively can you solve complex problems?
q10.struggle: Struggle - Have difficulty with complex problems
q10.proficient: Proficient - Handle most complex problems well

q1.question: How often do you experience brain fog or mental cloudiness?
q1.occasional: Occasionally - A few times a month

q2.question: Have you noticed changes in your memory since perimenopause/menopause?

q3.question: Do you struggle to find the right words when speaking?

q4.question: How has your ability to concentrate been affected?

q5.question: How quickly does mental fatigue set in during cognitive tasks?

q6.question: How are hot flushes or night sweats affecting your sleep and cognition?
q6.severe: Severe - Major sleep disruption, significant cognitive impact
q6.moderate: Moderate - Regular disruption affecting mental clarity

q7.question: How do mood changes affect your cognitive function?
q7.major: Major impact - Mood swings severely affect thinking
q7.significant: Significant - Clear cognitive impact from mood

q8.question: How often do you forget what you're doing mid-task?
q8.constantly: Constantly - Lose track multiple times daily

q9.question: How has your decision-making ability been affected?

q10.question: Overall, how much are hormonal changes affecting your cognitive function?
q10.severely: Severely - Major decline in all areas
q10.significantly: Significantly - Clear impact across multiple areas
